result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony T Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders a fine of $200.00 plus all costs, assessments and surcharges with CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY and balance if any to be returned.
If outstanding balance owing defendant has 90 days to pay or a civil judgment is to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony T Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony T Davis in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to BAIL JUMPING, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(a), a Class A misdemeanor.
To the amended charge,  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 68 days House of Correction with credit for 68 days time served.
Court orders a fine of $200.00 plus all costs, assessments and surcharges with CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY and balance if any to be returned.
If outstanding balance owing defendant has 90 days to pay or a civil judgment is to be entered.

Defendant Anthony T Davis in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties remains ready to Trial. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 10/26/2015 at 8:15 am.
Motion To Release Defendant From GPS Monitoring received and filed with court.

Defendant Anthony T Davis in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is able to proceed on 15CF1805, but is not certain if witnesses are present for this case and if it can proceed.  Personal service has not been completed on all witnesses.  The court will adjourn for another trial date.  Defendant waives miranda hearing.
Other Acts motion has previously been granted.  New jury trial date of 10-26-2015 is set.
Defense motion to  release defendant from GPS monitoring is argued and DENIED.  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:16 am.

The Court maintains the current Conditions of GPS Release Supervision, and defense motion can be addressed again on the next date.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-5-2015 at 8:15 am.   mld

15RM023788  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-07-15

Defendant Anthony T Davis in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Anthony T Davis in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the Criminal Complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Nicole Pritzlaff from Justice Point.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All available discovery was turned over to defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense counse, per the State.  

Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CF4102 and 2015CF1805.  Defense counsel objected to the joinder of cases.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel on case 2015CF1805.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 5-11-2015 at 8:30 am, on case 2015CF1805, based on new case 2015CF1805.  Court ordered both cases combined for a Speedy Trial in Branch 4 on 8-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-17-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 8-5-2015 at 1:30 pm. 

Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered that the cash bond on case 2014CF4102 is converted to a signature bond in the amount of $2,000.00.  Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Justice Point Worker, Nicole Pritzlaff.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NICOLE P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony T Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Anthony T Davis in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
